channel.title: Homes on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on My New Hugo Site

item.description: Elliptic Curves $$y^2 = x^3 + Ax + B$$ There are two parameters that define elliptic curves: $A$ and $B$ Examples Bitcoin uses a curve called secp256k1. The equation looks like $$y^2 = x^3 + 7$$ so $A = 0$ and $B = 7$. Many major messaging services including Whatsapp and Signal use a curve called X25519. The equation of the curve is too big to show here.
